column4: my father has just mounted a new hd here. i want to move a folder to this new hd, but i have no permission to do it! i have tried to move using the sudo command, but it didn't work. can someone help me?
what filesystem is on the new hd?
ntfs, but i have installed ntfs-3g
have you done what the wiki page ubotu just gave you says?
uhn, i'll try here, and i'll let you know
i just can't find it on the wiki!
did ubotu send you a message?
yes, but i already have the ntsc-3g installed
yes, but I asked if you followed all of the instructions on that page, including installing and running ntfs-config
yes, i did
pastebin your /etc/fstab
on pvt?
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/38605/
there are no lines for ntfs-3g on there, can you try running ntfs-config again and telling it to enable your ntfs partition again?
strange, i have done it. may i should reboot?
no, try running again, but make sure you check the partitions you want to access and hit apply
i've done, but it just remains the same. uhn, maybe it isn't ntfs?
maybe... is there any data on it?  Why not just format it as ext3?
but i'll use it on an windows machine later, would it have any problem?
windows can read ext3 if you install a driver.  If it's just for data and such, it will work fine
oh, great. and how can i format it this way?
oh, great. and how can i format it this way?
install gparted and then use system -> administration -> GNOME Partition editor
